      • openFile

        public abstract FileEditor [] openFile(VirtualFile file,
                                       boolean focusEditor)
        Parameters:
        file - file to open. File should be valid. Must be called from EDT.
        Returns:
        array of opened editors

      • openFile

        public FileEditor [] openFile(VirtualFile file,
                              boolean focusEditor,
                              boolean searchForOpen)
        Opens a file. Must be called from EDT.
        Parameters:
        file - file to open
        focusEditor - true if need to focus
        Returns:
        array of opened editors

      • closeFile

        public abstract void closeFile(VirtualFile file)
        Closes all editors opened for the file. Must be called from EDT.
        Parameters:
        file - file to be closed.

      • openTextEditor

        public abstract Editor openTextEditor(OpenFileDescriptor descriptor,
                                      boolean focusEditor)
        Works as openFile(VirtualFile, boolean) but forces opening of text editor (see TextEditor). If several text editors are opened, including the default one, default text editor is focused (if requested) and returned. Must be called from EDT.
        Returns:
        opened text editor. The method returns null in case if text editor wasn't opened.

      • navigateToTextEditor

        @Deprecated
public void navigateToTextEditor(OpenFileDescriptor descriptor,
                                 boolean focusEditor)
        Deprecated. use openTextEditor(OpenFileDescriptor, boolean)

      • getSelectedTextEditor

        public abstract Editor getSelectedTextEditor()
        Returns:
        currently selected text editor. The method returns null in case there is no selected editor at all or selected editor is not a text one. Must be called from EDT.

      • isFileOpen

        public abstract boolean isFileOpen(VirtualFile file)
        Returns:
        true if file is opened, false otherwise

      • getOpenFiles

        public abstract VirtualFile [] getOpenFiles()
        Returns:
        all opened files. Order of files in the array corresponds to the order of editor tabs.

      • hasOpenFiles

        public boolean hasOpenFiles()

      • getSelectedFiles

        public abstract VirtualFile [] getSelectedFiles()
        Returns:
        files currently selected. The method returns empty array if there are no selected files. If more than one file is selected (split), the file with most recent focused editor is returned first.

      • getSelectedEditors

        public abstract FileEditor [] getSelectedEditors()
        Returns:
        editors currently selected. The method returns empty array if no editors are open.

      • getSelectedEditor

        public FileEditor getSelectedEditor()
        Returns:
        currently selected file editor or null if there is no selected editor at all.

      • getSelectedEditor

        public abstract FileEditor getSelectedEditor(VirtualFile file)
        Returns:
        editor which is currently selected for given file. The method returns null if file is not opened.

      • getEditors

        public abstract FileEditor [] getEditors(VirtualFile file)
        Returns:
        current editors for the specified file

      • getAllEditors

        public abstract FileEditor [] getAllEditors(VirtualFile file)
        Returns:
        all editors for the specified file

      • getAllEditors

        public abstract FileEditor [] getAllEditors()
        Returns:
        all open editors

      • addTopComponent

        public abstract void addTopComponent(FileEditor editor,
                                     javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Adds the specified component above the editor and paints a separator line below it. If a separator line is not needed, set the client property to true: 
            component.putClientProperty(SEPARATOR_DISABLED, true);
        Otherwise, a separator line will be painted by a SEPARATOR_ABOVE_COLOR or TEARLINE_COLOR if it is not set.

        This method allows to add several components above the editor. To change an order of components the specified component may implement the Weighted interface.

      • removeTopComponent

        public abstract void removeTopComponent(FileEditor editor,
                                        javax.swing.JComponent component)

      • addBottomComponent

        public abstract void addBottomComponent(FileEditor editor,
                                        javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Adds the specified component below the editor and paints a separator line above it. If a separator line is not needed, set the client property to true: 
            component.putClientProperty(SEPARATOR_DISABLED, true);
        Otherwise, a separator line will be painted by a SEPARATOR_BELOW_COLOR or TEARLINE_COLOR if it is not set.

        This method allows to add several components below the editor. To change an order of components the specified component may implement the Weighted interface.

      • removeBottomComponent

        public abstract void removeBottomComponent(FileEditor editor,
                                           javax.swing.JComponent component)

public void addFileEditorManagerListener(FileEditorManagerListener listener)

                                                      boolean focusEditor)
        Must be called from EDT.
        Returns:

      • getProject

        public abstract Project getProject()
        Returns the project with which the file editor manager is associated.
        Returns:
        the project instance.

      • registerExtraEditorDataProvider

                                                     Disposable parentDisposable)

      • getData

        public abstract java.lang.Object getData(java.lang.String dataId,
                                         Editor editor,
                                         Caret caret)
        Returns data associated with given editor/caret context. Data providers are registered via registerExtraEditorDataProvider(EditorDataProvider, Disposable) method.

      • setSelectedEditor

        public abstract void setSelectedEditor(VirtualFile file,
                                       java.lang.String fileEditorProviderId)
        Selects a specified file editor tab for the specified editor.
        Parameters:
        file - a file to switch the file editor tab for. The function does nothing if the file is not currently open in the editor.
        fileEditorProviderId - the ID of the file editor to open; matches the return value of FileEditorProvider.getEditorTypeId()

      • runWhenLoaded

        public abstract void runWhenLoaded(Editor editor,
                                   java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        FileEditorManager supports asynchronous opening of text editors, i.e. when one of 'openFile' methods returns, returned editor might not be fully initialized yet. This method allows to delay (if needed) execution of given runnable until editor is fully loaded.
